prompt: <description>Part 1: Creating a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. We will create this part in four steps: defining the coordinate system, creating the sketches, and extruding the sketches to create the 3D model. I. Define the coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] II. Create the first sketch Switch to the XY plane of the newly created coordinate system and create the first sketch with the following components: * Face 1: + Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0938] to [0.1875, 0.0938] - Line 2: [0.1875, 0.0938] to [0.1875, 0.1875] - Line 3: [0.1875, 0.1875] to [0.0, 0.1875] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.1875] to [0.0, 0.0938] III. Create the second sketch Create the second sketch by adding features to the first sketch: * Face 2: + Loop 1: - Line 1: [0.1875, 0.0] to [0.2734, 0.0] - Arc 1: [0.2734, 0.0], [0.279, 0.0023], [0.2812, 0.0078] - Line 2: [0.2812, 0.0078] to [0.2812, 0.1797] - Arc 2: [0.2812, 0.1797], [0.279, 0.1852], [0.2734, 0.1875] - Line 3: [0.2734, 0.1875] to [0.1875, 0.1875] - Line 4: [0.1875, 0.1875] to [0.1875, 0.0938] - Line 5: [0.1875, 0.0938] to [0.1875, 0.0] IV. Extrude the sketches to create the 3D model Extrude both sketches simultaneously along the Z-axis by the value of 0.75 units to create a solid rectangular prism. The resulting part should have the following dimensions: * Height: 0.2812 * Width: 0.75 * Length: 0.2812</description>
